results.title: Emotional and social development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
Discusses Erikson’s eight stages of development looking at the first two stages of trust versus mistrust and autonomy versus shame and doubt as applying to infants. A newborn baby moves through a development process to become a social being. Focuses on critical periods in development such as stranger anxiety, attachment, separation anxiety and preparation-individuation.

results.title: Emotion
results.creator_credit: Robert Aller and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
What exactly are emotions, and why do they have the power to dictate our lives? The first part of this program discusses the question of whether there are emotional responses common to and recognisable by all cultures, or whether culture plays a significant role in how emotion is expressed. There seem to be three consideration when studying emotion: what your body does, what your mind does and what you have learnt to do, and the latter part of the program looks at anger and anxiety in particular and how these powerful emotions can be used or controlled with these three considerations in mind.

results.title: Emit
results.brief_description: Emit is a clock brought to life by the Voyager space probe’s final plummet to the surface of a post-apocalyptic, rubbish covered planet not disimilar to our own. Emit stopped at 11:55, as did the rest of the planet. Now he is ticking again, he sets out to find life and discover what makes it tick. But not everything is what it seems.

results.title: Emergency obstetrics
results.creator_credit: Richard Scott, Medi-Cine and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Shows emergency medical technicians how to assist in emergency childbirth. Demonstrates step-by-step procedures showing two live births and the critical situation of a prolapsed umbilical cord. Narrated by Lynne Littman.

results.title: Emergency in Africa
results.brief_description: A documentary that looks at the emergency situation that exists in Africa. There is not enough food being produced to feed the people and a great proportion of the population, especially the children, suffer from disease and malnutrition. This film examines the type of relief that is being provided by the UNICEF organisation.

results.title: Emergency childbirth
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Paul Burnford Educational Films
results.brief_description: This film utilises actual birth footage along with animation, models and live-action in order to demonstrate the two main steps you will take in an emergency childbirth, ie evaluating the situation and assisting the delivery. In this instance the emergency birth is taking place in a park.

results.title: Emergency bridge - Hutt Gully
results.brief_description: Shows the step-by-step erection of a Bailey bridge by the Country Roads Board over a washaway on the Great Ocean Road, Victoria. In twelve hours, over 11 inches of rain had fallen, causing a gully 110 feet wide and 50 feet deep, thus completely stopping traffic. Twelve hours later traffic was flowing across a prefabricated bridge built by the Board as a temporary measure.

results.title: Emergency at Wallaby Creek
results.creator_credit: David Baker, Roger Mirams, Pacific Films and Rod McNeil
results.brief_description: An episode from the series: “The Terrific adventures of the terrible ten”. One of the boy’s of Ten Town falls ill and is taken to Ten town hospital. The boy hero of the story discovers dead fish in the dam and figures out that the aerial spraying from a crop duster is poisoning life in the area. He runs to tell the adults - there is no one in the police station - and the council water engineer won’t listen, so the hero goes and shuts down the town water supply to prevent poisoning. Cinematographer/Director of Photography: Bruce McNaughton
